thread.title: Royals SS Alcides Escobar wins ALCS MVP
thread.title_full: Royals SS Alcides Escobar wins ALCS MVP - UPI.com

author: upi.com
title: Royals SS Alcides Escobar wins ALCS MVP
text:
1 of 3 | License Photo Kansas City Royals shortstop and leadoff hitter Alcides Escobar was named the MVP of the American League Championship Series on Friday.
On top of his usual defensive contributions, Escobar set a postseason record by getting a leadoff hit in the first four games of a series. He went 11-for-23 in the ALCS, which the Royals clinched after a Game 6 win over the Toronto Blue Jays.
The Royals, who advance to their second consecutive World Series, will be gunning to win this time when it opens Tuesday against the New York Mets.
Escobar followed teammate Lorenzo Cain, who won the ALCS MVP last season.
  Royals keeping same roster for ALCS Royals' Escobar put on concussion DL MLB: Kansas City 7, Cleveland 6 (11 inn.) Royals crush Twins, move to 7-0
